text: Hello, I can’t login to my HubSpot account because did’t receive confirmation code for login from HubSpot, so i guess HubSpot mailing system is having problem to send mail
anyone here can help me with that ??
in the mean time you might try google login

Hi <@UJL4N3WN8> If you are using the native HubSpot | Mailchimp integration: <https://ecosystem.HubSpot.com/marketplace/apps/marketing/email/mailchimp> HubSpot will only send the contact's first name, last name, and email address to Mailchimp. <https://knowledge.HubSpot.com/pop-up-forms/connect-pop-up-forms-and-non-HubSpot-forms-to-mailchimp>
There may be a option to investigate the transfer of custom properties or hidden properties between the two apps by using a middleware iPaaS solution like Zapier
Thanks :thumbsup:
You should reach out to support maybe
Yes, Thanks :thumbsup:

has anybody messed around with account based marketing on HubSpot? Obviously you can do it with smart content for known contacts... but i was thinking of trying to do it via IP so even new visitors would see the specific content
how would you target based on IP?  do you have a list of prospect IPs?

I feel incredibly stupid having to ask this, but where can I turn on the search button in the search functionality. I have no idea where to edit that default module. I know there is already a switch for it, I just want to turn it on.
I’ve tried ABM with another provider for non-converted visitors and I’ll say that their ability to correctly identify the organization/vertical a user is in is patchy at best.
yeah was just looking for something that had a list of known company IP ranges we could use in conjunction with HubSpot to show account-based content
<https://app.HubSpot.com/ecosystem/166694/marketplace/apps/marketing/abm/triblio>
this seems like maybe it does it but i'm unsure... haven't really done much with ABM to date
I’ve heard that Triblio is pretty good
cool thanks for your thoughts!
<https://knowledge.HubSpot.com/cos-general/how-do-i-set-up-a-results-page-for-my-search-field-in-HubSpot>
not sure if this is what you're asking for but here's a basic guide on how to get search on a HubSpot site

I think it all depends on the size of businesses you’re targeting.  They’re more successful with enterprise than Small or Medium sized businesses.

I’ve worked with DemandBase before, and I found a lot of inconsistencies with their results (They aren’t able to identify anyone from my company of ~500 employees).

This sort of ABM targeting also depends on people accessing your site from their work network, or VPN.

With that being said, I’d try to keep personalizations to a minimum so that users aren’t getting a vastly different experience accessing at home vs in the office
Always happy to chat more about my experiences with ABM
<@U22PJPGK0> were you able to look at the link provided and let me know if there's a different link we can use to ensure this is minified/compressed?
I’ll ask around, but any improvements will likely be only to appease Google PageSpeed and make very marginal improvements in actual page performance. The file is already compressed and very small.

I’m trying to use a UTM_PARAMETER to pass headline text into a custom module so that with a simple URL string I can control the headline of the page.

Does anyone know how to do this?
`{{ request.query_dict.title }}` would be pulling in
<https://www.domain.com/page?title=HAPPY%20BIRTHDAY>
so if I did
```<h1>{{ request.query_dict.title }}</h1>```
it would print on page
`<h1>Happy Bithday</h1>`
<@U25PYL3Q8> You rock! Thanks so much for answering this for me. I’ll give that a try.
